summary.para: Represents a decimal data type that provides a sign and scale for a number (as in coordinates.)

Decimal variables are stored as 96-bit (12-byte) unsigned integers scaled by a variable power of 10. The power of 10 scaling factor specifies the number of digits to the right of the decimal point, and ranges from 0 to 28.

member.name: DECIMAL.scale
member.summary: The number of decimal places for the number. Valid values are from 0 to 28. So 12.345 is represented as 12345 with a scale of 3.

member.name: DECIMAL.sign
member.summary: Indicates the sign; 0 for positive numbers or DECIMAL_NEG for negative numbers. So -1 is represented as 1 with the DECIMAL_NEG bit set.

member.name: DECIMAL.signscale
member.summary: The sign and number of decimal places.

member.name: DECIMAL.Hi32
member.summary: The high 32 bits of the number.

member.name: DECIMAL.Lo32
member.summary: The low 32 bits of the number.

member.name: DECIMAL.Mid32
member.summary: The middle 32 bits of the number.

member.name: DECIMAL.Lo64
member.summary: The low 32 bits of the number.
